intro: Urophyllum memecyloides, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces vibrant, often purple or blue flowers that open in the morning and close by midday. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are twining and can reach several meters in length. Urophyllum memecyloides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
